summary: Email correspondence between attorney Matthew L. Schwartz and an unnamed recipient regarding a forfeiture-related question in the Epstein case. Schwartz clarifies his inquiry is unrelated to his firm's representation of certain victims, and the recipient directs him to the Epstein case team of AUSAs.

persons.name: Matthew L. Schwartz
persons.context: Attorney who sends an email inquiring about a forfeiture-related question in the Epstein case, clarifying it is not related to his firm's representation of certain victims.

keyFacts: Matthew L. Schwartz, an attorney, sought to discuss a time-sensitive Epstein-related forfeiture question in October 2019.
Schwartz clarified that his inquiry had nothing to do with his firm's representation of certain victims of Epstein.
The email recipient directed Schwartz to the Epstein case team of Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) as the appropriate contacts for Epstein-related matters.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal and forfeiture proceedings related to the Epstein case in late 2019.
The email includes a standard confidentiality notice regarding attorney-client privilege and protected information.
